clustergb.structure¶

For reading and writing LAMMPS-compatible structure files.

clustergb.structure.comment_count(counts)¶

Convert raw counts of atoms in the different cluster regions to a human-readable string.

Parameters:counts (list) – int values for the number of nonbulklike atoms, atoms in the inner sphere (excluding non-bulklike), the shell between the inner and outer sphere, and the balance of atoms in the cluster.
Returns:(str) – A comment describing the atom counts.
clustergb.structure.comment_radii(r_inner, r_outer, r)¶

Convert radii defining the cluster and sub-spheres to a human-readable string.

Parameters:
  • r_inner (float) – Inner sub-sphere radius.
  • r_outer (float) – Outer sub-sphere radius.
  • r (float) – Radius of the entire cluster.
Returns:

(str) – A comment describing the cluster radii.
clustergb.structure.read_xyz(fin, step=-1)¶

Reads a LAMMPS-dumped .xyz file.

Parameters:
  • fin (str) – File to read.
  • step (int) – Which frame to read. Can be negative to read from the end of the file. (Default is -1.)
Returns:

2-element tuple containing

  • (np.ndarray) – \((n, 3)\) cartesian xyz positions of all atoms. and their species ids.
  • (np.ndarray) – \((n,)\) and their int species flag.
clustergb.structure.read_xyzin(fin)¶

Reads ‘.xyzin’ file (the format for LAMMPS to read from when loading a structure.)

Parameters:fin (str) – File to read.
Returns:5-element tuple containing
  • (np.ndarray) – \((n, 3)\) cartesian xyz positions of all atoms. and their species ids.
  • (np.ndarray) – \((n,)\) and their int species flag.
  • (float), (float), (float) – The x-, y-, and z-lengths of the rectangular simulation cell.
clustergb.structure.reorder(pos, center, r_inner, r_outer, cna_vals=None, lattice_type=None)¶

Reorders a set of cartesian atomic positions positions so that non-bulk-like atoms are at the beginning of the position array, followed by inner atoms, followed by outer, followed by the balance of the list.

  • Non-bulk-like) Has a cna_vals id that doesn’t correspond to the bulk-indicator for the given lattice_type. If

    cna_vals is left as the default None type, this will be an empty list of positions.

  • Inner) The atoms whose position is within r_inner of the center point, but who are bulk-like.

  • Outer) Atoms who lie between r_inner and r_outer from center, whether they’re bulk-like or not.

  • Balance) The balance of atoms in the pos list, all farther that r_outer from center.

Parameters:
  • pos (np.ndarray) – \((n,3)\) Cartesian atom positions.
  • center (np.ndarray) – \((3,)\) center of the cluster.
  • r_inner (float) – Inner radius for partitioning the cluster.
  • r_outer (float) – Outer radius for partitioning the cluster.
  • cna_vals (np.ndarray) – \((n,)\) int LAMMPS common-neighbour analysis flags per atom. (Default has no non-bulk-like atoms.)
  • lattice_type (str) – The crystal lattice type (‘fcc’ or ‘bcc’.)
Returns:

2-element tuple containing

  • (np.ndarray) – \((n,3)\) atomic positions with atoms ordered non-bulklike, inner, outer, and balance.
  • (np.ndarray) – \((4,)\) int counts of atoms in the same order.
clustergb.structure.write_vorin(fout, pos)¶

Write a file with atomic position data formatted for voro++ to read.

Parameters:
  • fout (str) – Name of file to write to.
  • pos (np.ndarray) – \((n,3)\) Cartesian atomic positions to write.
clustergb.structure.write_xyzin(fout, pos, lx, ly=None, lz=None, species=None, nspecies=None, comment='Written with clustergb', mask=None)¶

Write an ‘.xyzin’ file, i.e. xyz formatted with some box information so it can be read by LAMMPS.

Parameters:
  • fout (str) – Name of file to write to.
  • pos (np.ndarray) – \((n,3)\) Cartesian atomic positions to write.
  • lx (float) – Periodic length in x-direction.
  • ly (float) – Periodic length in y-direction. (Default, None, uses lx value.)
  • lz (float) – Periodic length in z-direction. (Default, None, uses lx value.)
  • species (np.ndarray) – \((n,)\) int species identifiers. (Default, None, is all species 1.)
  • nspecies (int) – Number of species (must be at least as many as unique species in species array). (Default, None, counts the unique values in species.)
  • comment (str) – Comment string to put at head of file. Must be a single line or the file may not be read properly later. (Default is “Written with clustergb”.)
  • mask (np.ndarray) – \((n,)\) bool mask indicating which atoms should be written if only a subset is desired. (Default, None, writes the entire array of atoms.)
